channel.title: AutoTalkr - Now in version 1.1!
channel.description:
Please do note, this is my very first script. Even though this is a little late to post, as I've posted on other forums, but anyways, here's my AutoTalkr series. I'll be posting updates prior to their release.
[scar]{.Script Info: # ScriptName = .:The Thief Lord's AutoTalkr v1.0:. # Author = The Thief Lord # Description = AutoTalks whatever you want it to # Version = 1.0 # Date = Saturday, September 02, 2006 # Comments = This script hopefully should automatically type whatever you tell it to with a regulation limit. Please do remember, this is only my second script. Enjoy! # Copyright = This script is by The Thief Lord, any unauthorized editing or redistribution without credit will not be tolerated, and that person shall be reported to the local authorities and/or that site's administrator. /Script Info}
{Instructions: 1. Fill in what you want to say 2. Run the script
{Contact: E-mail: xx.the.thief.lord.xx@gmail.com
Messengers: AIM: thieflord63 MSN: thieflord63@hotmail.com (please do not e-mail this address) Yahoo: thieflord63@yahoo.com (please do not e-mail this address) }
program AutoTalkr; const Message1='Your Text Here'; procedure hello; begin SendKeys(Message1 + chr(chr(13)); wait(1000) end; begin repeat hello; until(false) end.
[/scar]
[scar]{.Script Info: # ScriptName = .:The Thief Lord's AutoTalkr v1.1:. # Author = The Thief Lord # Description = AutoTalks whatever you want it to # Version = 1.1 # Date = Saturday, September 03, 2006 # Comments = This script should automatically type whatever you tell it to with a human regulation limit, so it should be less detectable. Please do remember, this is only my third script. Enjoy! # Includes = To run this script, you'll need the Squig.txt include. # Copyright = This script is by The Thief Lord, any unauthorized editing or redistribution without credit will not be tolerated, and that person shall be reported to the local authorities and/or that site's administrator.
/Script Info}
{Instructions: 1. Fill in what you want to say 2. Run the script
{Contact: E-mail: xx.the.thief.lord.xx@gmail.com
Messengers: AIM: thieflord63 MSN: thieflord63@hotmail.com (please do not e-mail this address) Yahoo: thieflord63@yahoo.com (please do not e-mail this address) }
Program AutoTalker; {.include Squig.txt} const Message1='Your Text Here'; procedure AutoTalk; begin WriteIn('You are using The Thief Lords AutoTalker v1.1.'); SendKeysHuman(Message1 + chr(13)); Wait(1000); end; begin repeat AutoTalk; until(false) end.
[/scar]
NOTE: I am currently working on a script dump, and all previous versions from this thread shall be moved to that site in which you may access at your own free will.

item.title: AutoTalkr - Now in version 1.1!
item.dc:creator: @arr0w Arr0w
item.description:
@arr0w wrote:

[quote author=Jei Jei KK link=topic=24344.msg464282#msg464282 date=1163637416]

[quote=“junkj, post:4, topic:16290”]I just will say put spaces in this script…

program blah;

const

procedure blah;

like that! because its all mushed up and you cant tell which part is where.

[/quote

Potato mush!
No, really, don’t do like this
[scar]
program example;
const
example:1//example
var
exxamplle:string;
procedure something;
do_something
[/scar]
etc. Try to do them like this

[Scar]
Program Easier_to_read;

Const
Example = 1 // This is an example.

Var
Exxample:String;

Procedure Something;

Do_Something
[/scar]

That’s what i call english :)[/quote]
Next time write outside the quote box.

Read full topic

item.title: AutoTalkr - Now in version 1.1!
item.dc:creator: @wyn10 wyn10
item.description:
@wyn10 wrote:

[quote=“Weibs, post:2, topic:16290”]Good first script :). Just gonna point out a few things.

Where you have the Wait(1000) you should put Wait(1000+random(500)); When you’re dealing with runescape, almost everything should have a little randomness in it.

Also, try having more than one message to say, and having the script randomly say it. Example:

[code]Program AutoTalker;

{.include Squig.txt}

const
Message1=‘Your Text Here’;
Message2=‘Your second message’;
Message3=‘Weeeeee’;
Message4=‘Last message to say!’;

procedure AutoTalk;
Var
TheMessage: String;

begin
Case Random(4) of
0 : TheMessage:=Message1;
1 : TheMessage:=Message2;
2 : TheMessage:=Message3;
3 : TheMessage:=Message4;
End;
WriteIn(‘You are using The Thief Lords AutoTalker v1.1.’);
SendKeysHuman(TheMessage + chr(13));
Wait(1000+Random(500));
end;

begin
repeat
AutoTalk;
until(false)
end.[/code]

This uses a Case … of statement. I have the line Random(4) in there also. The random(4) returns either 0, 1, 2, or 3. Then, the 4 statements below the Case line, determine what to do with that number. If its 0, then it makes TheMessage equal to Message1. This way, the script will say a random phrase, instead of the same one over and over again.

My last tip would be this. You have a Repeat … Until(false) in your main loop. You could change that to:

Repeat AutoTalk; Until(IsFKeyDown(9));

This way the user could stop the script by pressing F9. Just incase ;).

Keep on expanding on this idea, and keep on scripting :).

-Weibs.[/quote]

ditto on everything he said

Read full topic

item.title: AutoTalkr - Now in version 1.1!
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Good first script :). Just gonna point out a few things.

Where you have the Wait(1000) you should put Wait(1000+random(500)); When you’re dealing with runescape, almost everything should have a little randomness in it.

Also, try having more than one message to say, and having the script randomly say it. Example:

[code]Program AutoTalker;

{.include Squig.txt}

const
Message1=‘Your Text Here’;
Message2=‘Your second message’;
Message3=‘Weeeeee’;
Message4=‘Last message to say!’;

procedure AutoTalk;
Var
TheMessage: String;

begin
Case Random(4) of
0 : TheMessage:=Message1;
1 : TheMessage:=Message2;
2 : TheMessage:=Message3;
3 : TheMessage:=Message4;
End;
WriteIn(‘You are using The Thief Lords AutoTalker v1.1.’);
SendKeysHuman(TheMessage + chr(13));
Wait(1000+Random(500));
end;

begin
repeat
AutoTalk;
until(false)
end.[/code]

This uses a Case … of statement. I have the line Random(4) in there also. The random(4) returns either 0, 1, 2, or 3. Then, the 4 statements below the Case line, determine what to do with that number. If its 0, then it makes TheMessage equal to Message1. This way, the script will say a random phrase, instead of the same one over and over again.

My last tip would be this. You have a Repeat … Until(false) in your main loop. You could change that to:

Repeat AutoTalk; Until(IsFKeyDown(9));

This way the user could stop the script by pressing F9. Just incase ;).

Keep on expanding on this idea, and keep on scripting :).

-Weibs.

Read full topic

item.title: AutoTalkr - Now in version 1.1!

@The_Thief_Lord wrote:

Please do note, this is my very first script. Even though this is a little late to post, as I’ve posted on other forums, but anyways, here’s my AutoTalkr series. I’ll be posting updates prior to their release.

[scar]{.Script Info:

ScriptName = .:The Thief Lord’s AutoTalkr v1.0:.

Author = The Thief Lord

Description = AutoTalks whatever you want it to

Version = 1.0

Date = Saturday, September 02, 2006

Comments = This script hopefully should automatically type whatever you tell it to with a regulation limit. Please do remember, this is only my second script. Enjoy!

Copyright = This script is by The Thief Lord, any unauthorized editing or redistribution without credit will not be tolerated, and that person shall be reported to the local authorities and/or that site’s administrator.

/Script Info}

{Instructions:

  1. Fill in what you want to say
  2. Run the script

{Contact:
E-mail:
xx.the.thief.lord.xx@gmail.com

Messengers:
AIM: thieflord63
MSN: thieflord63@hotmail.com (please do not e-mail this address)
Yahoo: thieflord63@yahoo.com (please do not e-mail this address)
}

program AutoTalkr;
const
Message1=‘Your Text Here’;
procedure hello;
begin
SendKeys(Message1 + chr(chr(13));
wait(1000)
end;
begin
repeat
hello;
until(false)
end.

[/scar]

[scar]{.Script Info:

ScriptName = .:The Thief Lord’s AutoTalkr v1.1:.

Author = The Thief Lord

Description = AutoTalks whatever you want it to

Version = 1.1

Date = Saturday, September 03, 2006

Comments = This script should automatically type whatever you tell it to with a human regulation limit, so it

should be less detectable. Please do remember, this is only my third script. Enjoy!

Includes = To run this script, you’ll need the Squig.txt include.

Copyright = This script is by The Thief Lord, any unauthorized editing or redistribution without credit will not

be tolerated, and that person shall be reported to the local authorities and/or that site’s administrator.

Yahoo: thieflord63@yahoo.com (please do not e-mail this address)
}

Program AutoTalker;
{.include Squig.txt}
const
Message1=‘Your Text Here’;
procedure AutoTalk;
begin
WriteIn(‘You are using The Thief Lords AutoTalker v1.1.’);
SendKeysHuman(Message1 + chr(13));
Wait(1000);
end;
begin
repeat
AutoTalk;
until(false)
end.

[/scar]
